page.title: 12TRANSPORT Canal 1
page.content: The Grand Union Canal, built in 1805 made a big difference to the community because it was used as a transport link and brought much trade in and out of Rickmansworth. Farmers used it too for heavy loads. Now, in 1985, the railway runs parallel to the canal from the east of our area to Batchworth Lock.There are still some factories near the canal which used it to carry their goods when they were opened earlier this century; but now they send them by lorries. During the summer many people rent a boat or barge (costing c.Â£200-Â£500) according to size) for a holiday on the canal.The traditional barges are long and narrow. They are brightly decorated with pictures and flowers painted on the sides.Every boat has a number and a licence just like a car.In the 19th. century, the cargo
